page.title: 18Riding for the Disabled
page.content: On 19 April 1983 the centre was opened by H.R.H.Princess Anne (patron of the Riding for the Disabled Association). The centre is named after Mrs Elisabeth Curtis,Chairman of the Eastern Region R.D.A.who died in 1981. It consists of an indoor school, toilets and tack room, office accommodation and 8 ponies.There are over 100 riders on the register, about 80 ride each week in 5 sessions requiring the help of 70 volunteers. Riders are all ages and disabilities and come from Bromham Hospital, Barkers Lane Adult Training Centre and special schools.They enjoy their riding and benefit from the physical and mental stimulation.More funds are needed for running costs of around Â£5000 p.a.
